Yii Framework 2.0 API Documentation
  • Class reference
nickcv\mandrill
Mailer Message

Class nickcv\mandrill\Message

All Classes | Methods
Inheritancenickcv\mandrill\Message » yii\mail\BaseMessage

Message is the class that is used to store the data of an email message that will be sent through Mandrill API.

Method Details

attach() public method

Attaches existing file to the email message.

See also nickcv\mandrill\Message::getAttachments() getter.

nickcv\mandrill\Message attach( $fileName, array $options = [] )
$fileName string

Full file name
$options array

Options for embed file. Valid options are:

  • fileName: name, which should be used to attach file.
  • contentType: attached file MIME type.
attachContent() public method

Attach specified content as file for the email message.

See also nickcv\mandrill\Message::getAttachments() getter.

$content string

Attachment file content.
$options array

Options for embed file. Valid options are:

  • fileName: name, which should be used to attach file.
  • contentType: attached file MIME type.

getBcc() public method

Returns an array of email addresses in the following format:

[
 'email1@example.com', //in case no recipient name was submitted
 'email2@example.com' => 'John Doe', //in case a recipient name was submitted
]

See also nickcv\mandrill\Message::setBcc() setter.

array getBcc( )

]

array getEmbeddedContent( )
return array

List of embedded content
getFrom() public method

Returns the from email address in this format:

Sender Name <email@example.com>

The default value for the sender name is the application name configuration parameter inside config/web.php.

The default value for the sender address is the adminEmail parameter inside config/params.php.

See also nickcv\mandrill\Message::setFrom() setter.

string getFrom( )

setBcc() public method

Sets the message recipient(s).

See also nickcv\mandrill\Message::getBcc() getter.

nickcv\mandrill\Message setBcc( $bcc )
$bcc string|array

Bcc email address. You may pass an array of addresses if multiple recipients should receive this message. You may also specify receiver name in addition to email address using format: [email => name].

Sets the message recipient(s).

setCharset() public method

Mandrill does not let users set a charset.

See also nickcv\mandrill\Message::getCharset() getter.

$charset string

setFrom() public method

Sets the message sender.

See also nickcv\mandrill\Message::getFrom() getter.

nickcv\mandrill\Message setFrom( $from )
$from string|array

Sender email address. You may specify sender name in addition to email address using format: [email => name]. If you don't set this parameter the application adminEmail parameter will be used as the sender email address and the application name will be used as the sender name.
setGlobalMergeVars() public method (available since version 1.4.0)

Adds the given merge vars to the global merge vars array.

Merge vars are case insensitive and cannot start with _

nickcv\mandrill\Message setGlobalMergeVars( array $mergeVars )
$mergeVars array

See also nickcv\mandrill\Message::getReplyTo() getter.

nickcv\mandrill\Message setReplyTo( $replyTo )
$replyTo string|array

Reply-To email address. You may pass an array of addresses if multiple recipients should receive this message. You may also specify receiver name in addition to email address using format: [email => name].
setSubject() public method

Sets the message subject.

See also nickcv\mandrill\Message::getSubject() getter.

nickcv\mandrill\Message setSubject( $subject )
$subject string

The subject will be trimmed and html-encoded.
setTags() public method

Mandrill lets you use tags to categorize your messages, making it much easier to find the messages your are looking for within their website dashboard.

Stats are accumulated within mandrill using tags, though they only store the first 100 they see, so this should not be unique or change frequently. Tags should be 50 characters or less. Any tags starting with an underscore are reserved for internal use and will be ignored.

Some common tags include registration and password reset.

See also nickcv\mandrill\Message::getTags() getter.

nickcv\mandrill\Message setTags( $tag )
$tag string|array

Tag or list of tags
setTemplateData() public method (available since version 1.3.0)

Sets the data to be used by the Mandrill template system.

$templateName string
$templateContent array

Sets the message recipient(s).

nickcv\mandrill\Message setTo( $to )
$to string|array

Receiver email address. You may pass an array of addresses if multiple recipients should receive this message. You may also specify receiver name in addition to email address using format: [email => name].
